Posts.Content: jadatemple wrote: Harold the hangy ball has been evicted(mydrain)!  I feel so much better and I could shower!  My surgeons office called and said that my pathology report has been possibly delayed.  The pathologist wants to be sure and is getting a second opinion.  Okay so I am trying to be patient but then my mind starts racing like ...do I have some bizarro form of bc, or is it so bad it is unbelievable and the are doulble checking.  I know it is important to be thorough but if I could just be labotimized until the results came in that would be helpful!  I hate waiting!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Sorry for y.elling Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Eviction jadatemple crazydaisy

Posts.Content: jadatemple wrote: I went for my biopsy and it was okay.  I must say I was pretty scared but the support I have received in this space helped me so much.  The doctor and tech I had were fantastic.  I am starting to find my strength, although I still have some down times.  I think that comes mostly from the unknown.  I think the best advice I have gotten from here is that it is doable and I trust in those who have gone before me.  I also realize that with the possibility of the big C comes an attitude of forboding doom.  That doesn't work for me.  The quiet and sterility of the hospitals are terrifying.  My partner came with me and after the procedure we laughed and I felt so much better.  I know this may sound crazy but while the biopsy was being done I was speaking to my maybe invader and let it know that we knew about it and that we were coming for it and to prepare for a fight.  I know it sounds nuts but it gave me a sense of control and empowerment.  I don't mind a good fight it is the sadness that takes its toll on me.  Anyways , I just wanted to say thanks again for the support anf all of you are in my thoughts.  My fellow warriors Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Biopsy jadatemple jadatemple

Posts.Content: Jan 21, 2008 08:44AM jadatemple wrote: Thanks HeatherLocklear I love your attitude towards this disease and life.  Today I am supposed to get the results.  Yikes!
